meanings.definition: To alter or change something again.
meanings.sent1: She decided to start realtering her essay after receiving feedback from her teacher.
meanings.sent2: The tailor was realtering the dress to make it fit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: After realtering the recipe multiple times, she finally got it just right.
meanings.sent4: The artist kept realtering the painting until it captured the exact emotion she wanted.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was realtering the engine to improve its performance.

meanings.definition: The act of altering or changing something again.
meanings.sent1: The realtering of the contract caused some confusion among the team.
meanings.sent2: His realtering of the presentation slides made them more engaging.
meanings.sent3: The realtering of the schedule led to a mix-up in meeting times.
meanings.sent4: The realtering of the garden layout created a more harmonious design.
meanings.sent5: The realtering of the policy resulted in better employee satisfaction.
